label: A_tP4_136_f-001
title: $\gamma$-N Structure
comments:
Solid nitrogen is found in three forms (Mills, 1969; Donohue, 1974): \begin{itemize} \item The ground state $\alpha$-N structure, stable below 35.6K, found either in a \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cP8_205_c-001}{centrosymmetric} or a \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cP8_198_2a-001}{non-centrosymmetric} cubic structure. \item The hexagonal $\beta$-phase, which has freely rotating N$_{2}$ molecules and is stable up to the melting point, and \item High-pressure \href{current_web_home_dir/A_tP4_136_f-001}{$\gamma$-N}, stable above 355 MPa. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 We use the data from (Mills, 1969) taken at 415 MPa and 20.5K.
